intro: Trachyandra arenicola, commonly known as the sand lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its unique, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
